item.title: Azure Digital Twins Control-Plane Preview API Retirement (2021-06-31)

item.atom:content: Azure Digital Twins is now available in 14 Azure regions worldwide including West US 3, Qatar Central, Japan East, and Korea Central.

item.atom:content: Azure Digital Twins now supports both system-assigned and user-assigned managed identities for authenticating to supported endpoints for routing digital twin events.

item.title: General availability: Trusted launch for Azure VMs in Azure for US Government regions

item.atom:content: Allows you to enable secure boot, vTPM, virtualization-based security, and Microsoft Defender for Cloud integration, providing additional layers of defense against sophisticated threats.

item.atom:content: New plan offers greater resiliency, scalability, and flexibility - helping you add real-time two-way communication to your web and mobile apps.

item.atom:content: Azure Red Hat OpenShift is now generally available for Azure Government customers (federal, state, local governments, and their partners).

item.atom:content: Mounting Azure Storage File share as a network share in Windows code (non-container) in App Service is now generally available.

item.atom:content: Extended migration period for your IaaS VMs from Azure Service Manager to Azure Resource Manager. Please complete the migration by 1 September 2023.

item.title: General availability: Azure Monitor Logs, custom log API and ingestion-time transformations

item.atom:content: New Custom Log API and Ingestion-time Transformations announced in Azure Monitor Logs.

item.title: Generally available Day 0 support for .NET 7.0 on App Service
item.description: Day 0 support for .NET 7.0 on App Service.
item.atom:content: Day 0 support for .NET 7.0 on App Service.

item.title: General availability: Azure Monitor agent custom and IIS logs
item.description: Azure Monitor agent team has shipped custom log collection and IIS log collection.
item.atom:content: Azure Monitor agent team has shipped custom log collection and IIS log collection.

item.title: General Availability of Cross Zonal Restore of Azure Virtual Machines from Azure Backup
item.description: Cross Zonal Restore for Azure Virtual Machines helps to restore to any zone of your choice.
item.atom:content: Cross Zonal Restore for Azure Virtual Machines helps to restore to any zone of your choice.

item.title: Public preview: Enhanced metrics for Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server
item.description: Have more visibility and fine-grained control of your Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server instances with new enhanced metrics.
item.atom:content: Have more visibility and fine-grained control of your Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server instances with new enhanced metrics.

item.title: Public preview: Premium series hardware for Azure SQL Database Hyperscale
item.description: Leverage new premium-series hardware based on the latest Intel CPUs that offers significantly improved performance and scalability on Azure SQL Database Hyperscale.
item.atom:content: Leverage new premium-series hardware based on the latest Intel CPUs that offers significantly improved performance and scalability on Azure SQL Database Hyperscale.

item.title: Private preview: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Backup
item.description: Azure Backup is announcing private preview of AKS Backup providing ability to backup and restore AKS clusters.
item.atom:content: Azure Backup is announcing private preview of AKS Backup providing ability to backup and restore AKS clusters.

item.title: Public Preview: Use Azure Quota Rest APIs to manage service limits (quotas)
item.description: Use Azure REST Quota API to manage service limits (quotas), query current usage and quotas, and even update limits for your supported Azure resources, when required.
item.atom:content: Use Azure REST Quota API to manage service limits (quotas), query current usage and quotas, and even update limits for your supported Azure resources, when required.

item.title: Public preview: Cross Subscription Restore for Azure Virtual Machines
item.description: Cross Subscription Restore for Azure Virtual Machines is provides flexibility to choose any subscription during restore.
item.atom:content: Cross Subscription Restore for Azure Virtual Machines is provides flexibility to choose any subscription during restore.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Bastion now support shareable links
item.description: Shareable links allows users to connect to target resources via Azure Bastion without access to the Azure portal.
item.atom:content: Shareable links allows users to connect to target resources via Azure Bastion without access to the Azure portal.

item.title: Public preview: Add an Azure Cosmos DB custom endpoint in IoT Hub
item.description: Azure IoT Hub now supports the ability to setup an Azure Cosmos DB account as a custom endpoint. This will help route device data from IoT Hub to Azure Cosmos DB directly.
item.atom:content: Azure IoT Hub now supports the ability to setup an Azure Cosmos DB account as a custom endpoint. This will help route device data from IoT Hub to Azure Cosmos DB directly.

item.title: Public preview: Azure SQL trigger for Azure Functions
item.description: You can invoke an Azure Function when a row in a SQL database is created, updated, or deleted through the Azure SQL trigger for Azure Functions, now available in public preview.
item.atom:content: You can invoke an Azure Function when a row in a SQL database is created, updated, or deleted through the Azure SQL trigger for Azure Functions, now available in public preview.

item.title: General availability: Arm-based VMs now available in four additional Azure regions
item.description: The Azure Arm-based VMs are now available in four more regions.
item.atom:content: The Azure Arm-based VMs are now available in four more regions.

item.title: General availability: DR secondary free with SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines
item.description: Optimize business costs by licensing your Disaster Recovery secondary for free with SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines.
item.atom:content: Optimize business costs by licensing your Disaster Recovery secondary for free with SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines.

item.title: Public preview: License Geo-redundant Disaster Recovery for SQL Managed Instance for free
item.description: Save on business continuity costs and license geographically redundant Disaster Recovery with Azure SQL Managed Instance.
item.atom:content: Save on business continuity costs and license geographically redundant Disaster Recovery with Azure SQL Managed Instance.

item.title: Generally available: Azure SQL Managed Instance backup portability to SQL Server 2022
item.description: Backup of your Azure SQL Managed Instance database can now be restored to a SQL Server 2022 instance.
item.atom:content: Backup of your Azure SQL Managed Instance database can now be restored to a SQL Server 2022 instance.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Synapse Link for SQL
item.description: Azure Synapse Link for SQL enables seamless near-real-time data movement from relational sources in Azure SQL Database and SQL Server 2022 to analytical stores without needing to build ETL pipelines.
item.atom:content: Azure Synapse Link for SQL enables seamless near-real-time data movement from relational sources in Azure SQL Database and SQL Server 2022 to analytical stores without needing to build ETL pipelines.

item.title: Generally available: Azure SQL Managed Instance link for SQL Server 2022
item.description: The link feature in Azure SQL Managed Instance connects your SQL Servers hosted anywhere to SQL Managed Instance, providing hybrid flexibility and database mobility.
item.atom:content: The link feature in Azure SQL Managed Instance connects your SQL Servers hosted anywhere to SQL Managed Instance, providing hybrid flexibility and database mobility.

item.title: Public preview: Azure SQL Managed Instance feature wave updates for November 2022
item.description: New feature wave enhancements for Azure SQL Managed Instance make it even more performant, reliable, and secure with on-premises SQL Server and the broader Azure platform.
item.atom:content: New feature wave enhancements for Azure SQL Managed Instance make it even more performant, reliable, and secure with on-premises SQL Server and the broader Azure platform.

item.title: General availability: Azure SQL Managed Instance feature wave updates for November 2022
item.description: New feature wave enhancements for Azure SQL Managed Instance make it even more performant, reliable, and secure with on-premises SQL Server and the broader Azure platform.
item.atom:content: New feature wave enhancements for Azure SQL Managed Instance make it even more performant, reliable, and secure with on-premises SQL Server and the broader Azure platform.

item.atom:content: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-November 2022.

item.atom:content: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-November 2022.

item.title: General availability: Azure Sphere TKS updated; OS version 22.11 expected December 1
item.description: Participate in retail evaluation now to ensure compatibility. The Azure Sphere team has also updated the trusted keystore of Azure Sphere devices, resulting in an additional reboot for production devices.
item.atom:content: Participate in retail evaluation now to ensure compatibility. The Azure Sphere team has also updated the trusted keystore of Azure Sphere devices, resulting in an additional reboot for production devices.

item.title: General availability: TLS 1.3 with Application Gateway
item.description: Start using the new policies with TLS 1.3 for your Azure Application Gateway to improve security and performance.
item.atom:content: Start using the new policies with TLS 1.3 for your Azure Application Gateway to improve security and performance.

item.title: General availability: Per Rule Actions on regional Web Application Firewall
item.description: Azure's regional Web Application Firewall on Application Gateway now supports customizing actions per rule. This new functionality allows you greater control over how the Web Application Firewall handles incoming traffic.
item.atom:content: Azure's regional Web Application Firewall on Application Gateway now supports customizing actions per rule. This new functionality allows you greater control over how the Web Application Firewall handles incoming traffic.

item.title: General availability: Bot Manager Rule Set 1.0 on regional Web Application Firewall
item.description: This rule set provides you enhanced protection against bots and provides granular control over bots detected by WAF by categorizing bot traffic as good, bad, or unknown bots.
item.atom:content: This rule set provides you enhanced protection against bots and provides granular control over bots detected by WAF by categorizing bot traffic as good, bad, or unknown bots.

item.title: Public preview: Use Azure Quota REST APIs to manage service limits (quotas)
item.description: Use Azure REST Quota APIs to manage the service limits (quotas) for Azure VMs, HPC Cache, Purview services, and networking.
item.atom:content: Use Azure REST Quota APIs to manage the service limits (quotas) for Azure VMs, HPC Cache, Purview services, and networking.

item.title: Generally available: Encrypt managed disks with cross-tenant customer-managed keys
item.description: Protect your data by encrypting Premium SSD, Standard SSD, and Standard HDD managed disks with cross tenant customer-managed keys.
item.atom:content: Protect your data by encrypting Premium SSD, Standard SSD, and Standard HDD managed disks with cross tenant customer-managed keys.

item.title: Limited preview: Azure Backup support for confidential VMs using Platform Managed Keys
item.description: You can use this feature to back up confidential VMs using Platform Managed Keys.
item.atom:content: You can use this feature to back up confidential VMs using Platform Managed Keys.

item.title: Azure Resource Manager — Migrating to TLS 1.2 with Deprecation of Outdated Security Protocols
item.description: Azure Resource Manager will be deprecating support for TLS 1.1 and older in Fall 2023. To maintain an uninterrupted connection with Azure Resource Manager, update your operating systems and work environments to support TLS 1.2.
item.atom:content: Azure Resource Manager will be deprecating support for TLS 1.1 and older in Fall 2023. To maintain an uninterrupted connection with Azure Resource Manager, update your operating systems and work environments to support TLS 1.2.

item.title: Public preview: Microsoft Azure Managed HSM TLS Offload Library
item.description: Azure Managed HSM now supports SSL/TLS Offload for F5 and Nginx.
item.atom:content: Azure Managed HSM now supports SSL/TLS Offload for F5 and Nginx.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Front Door integration with managed identities
item.description: Azure Front Door Standard and Premium supports enabling managed identities for Azure Front Door to access Azure Key Vault.
item.atom:content: Azure Front Door Standard and Premium supports enabling managed identities for Azure Front Door to access Azure Key Vault.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Maps Creator feature - Wayfinding
item.description: Wayfinding in Azure Maps Creator enables you to provide your users with the shortest path between two points within a facility.
item.atom:content: Wayfinding in Azure Maps Creator enables you to provide your users with the shortest path between two points within a facility.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Front Door zero downtime migration
item.description: You can use this feature to migrate Azure Front Door (classic) to Azure Front Door Standard and Premium with zero downtime.
item.atom:content: You can use this feature to migrate Azure Front Door (classic) to Azure Front Door Standard and Premium with zero downtime.

item.title: Public preview: Upgrade from Azure Front Door Standard to Premium tier
item.description: You can now use this feature to upgrade your Azure Front Door Standard profile to Premium tier without downtime.
item.atom:content: You can now use this feature to upgrade your Azure Front Door Standard profile to Premium tier without downtime.

item.title: Azure Machine Learning—Generally availability updates for November 2022
item.description: New GA features include the ability to automate auto-shutdown/auto-start schedules, configure and customize a compute instance, seamlessly build NLP/vision models, and assess AI systems.
item.atom:content: New GA features include the ability to automate auto-shutdown/auto-start schedules, configure and customize a compute instance, seamlessly build NLP/vision models, and assess AI systems.

item.title: Azure Percept DK Retirement Announcement
item.description: Azure Percept DK and support from associated Azure services will be retired on March 30th, 2023.
item.atom:content: Azure Percept DK and support from associated Azure services will be retired on March 30th, 2023.

item.title: Azure Machine Learning—Public preview updates for November 2022
item.description: New public preview features include reading Delta Lakes in fewer steps, debugging and monitoring training jobs, and performing data wrangling.
item.atom:content: New public preview features include reading Delta Lakes in fewer steps, debugging and monitoring training jobs, and performing data wrangling.

item.title: General availability: Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server in new China regions
item.description: Deploy Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server workloads in two new China regions.
item.atom:content: Deploy Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server workloads in two new China regions.

item.title: General availability: Multivariate Anomaly Detection
item.description: Multivariate Anomaly Detection will allow you to evaluate multiple signals and the correlations between them to find sudden changes in data patterns.
item.atom:content: Multivariate Anomaly Detection will allow you to evaluate multiple signals and the correlations between them to find sudden changes in data patterns.

item.title: Public preview: Azure SQL Database offline migrations in Azure SQL Migration extension
item.description: Assess, get right-sized Azure recommendations for Azure migration targets, and migrate databases offline from on-premises SQL Server to Azure SQL Database.
item.atom:content: Assess, get right-sized Azure recommendations for Azure migration targets, and migrate databases offline from on-premises SQL Server to Azure SQL Database.

item.title: General availability: Retryable writes in Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB
item.description: Develop your applications with more flexibility with retryable writes in Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB.
item.atom:content: Develop your applications with more flexibility with retryable writes in Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB.

item.title: Public preview: Intra-account container copy for Azure Cosmos DB
item.description: Intra-account container copy helps you create offline copies of containers within Azure Cosmos DB SQL API and Cassandra API accounts.
item.atom:content: Intra-account container copy helps you create offline copies of containers within Azure Cosmos DB SQL API and Cassandra API accounts.

item.title: General availability: New cost recommendations for Virtual Machine Scale Sets
item.description: You can use new cost recommendations for Virtual Machine Scale Sets for optimization.
item.atom:content: You can use new cost recommendations for Virtual Machine Scale Sets for optimization.

item.title: Generally available: Static Web Apps support for preview environments in Azure DevOps
item.description: Deploy applications to staging environments using Azure DevOps.
item.atom:content: Deploy applications to staging environments using Azure DevOps.

item.title: Generally available: Static Web Apps support for stable URLs for preview environments

item.atom:content: Use stable URLs with Azure Static Web Apps preview environments.

item.title: Generally available: Static Web Apps support for skipping API builds
item.description: You can skip the default API builds via GitHub Actions and Azure pipelines.
item.atom:content: You can skip the default API builds via GitHub Actions and Azure pipelines.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Static Web Apps now Supports Node 18

item.atom:content: Azure Static Web Apps now supports building and deploying full-stack Node 18 applications.

item.title: Generally available: Azure NetApp Files datastores for Azure VMware Solution

item.atom:content: Azure NetApp Files for datastores is now generally available in Azure VMware Solution.

item.atom:content: You can now update SSH keys on existing AKS nodepools post deployment.

item.title: Generally available: Azure IoT Edge for Linux on Windows (EFLOW) update

item.atom:content: The update brings enhancements to IoT Edge 1.4 and more.

item.title: General availability: Manage your Log Analytics Tables in Azure Portal

item.atom:content: Log Analytics Tables can now be managed from the tables entry of Azure Portal in Log Analytics workspaces.

item.title: General availability: Azure Automation supports Availability zones

item.atom:content: Azure Automation now supports Availability zones to provide improved resiliency and reliability to the service, runbooks and other automation assets.

item.title: Generally available: Increasing Azure Synapse Analytics Spark performance up to 77%
item.description: Faster Azure Synapse Analytics Spark performance at no cost.
item.atom:content: Faster Azure Synapse Analytics Spark performance at no cost.

item.title: Generally available: Block domain fronting behavior on newly created customer resources
item.description: All newly created Azure Front Door, Azure Front Door (classic) or Azure CDN Standard from Microsoft (classic) resources will block any HTTP request that exhibits domain fronting behavior.
item.atom:content: All newly created Azure Front Door, Azure Front Door (classic) or Azure CDN Standard from Microsoft (classic) resources will block any HTTP request that exhibits domain fronting behavior.

item.title: Generally available: Functions now supports .NET 7 in an isolated worker process

item.atom:content: Create applications with .NET 7 runtime to take advantage of serverless functions in Azure.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Static Web Apps now fully supports .NET 7
item.description: Azure Static Web Apps now supports building and deploying full-stack .NET 7.0 isolated applications.
item.atom:content: Azure Static Web Apps now supports building and deploying full-stack .NET 7.0 isolated applications.

item.title: Generally available: New node sizing for Azure VMware Solution

item.atom:content: Optimize workloads with new node sizes, AV52, and AV36P, now generally available in Azure VMware Solution.

item.title: General availability: Virtual Machine software reservations

item.atom:content: You can now save on Virtual Machine software from third-party publishers by purchasing software reservations.

item.title: Public preview: Exporting ISE and Consumption Logic Apps to Standard SKU

item.atom:content: Logic Apps Standard VS Code Extension now allows you to export groups of logic apps workflows deployed to Azure.

item.title: General availability: Default Rule Set 2.1 for Azure Web Application Firewall
item.description: Increase your security posture and reduce false positives with Default Rule Set 2.1, now generally available on Azure's global Web Application Firewall running on Azure Front Door.
item.atom:content: Increase your security posture and reduce false positives with Default Rule Set 2.1, now generally available on Azure's global Web Application Firewall running on Azure Front Door.

item.title: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server will be deprecated 30 September 2024

item.atom:content: Deprecation notice: transition from Azure MFA Server to Azure MFA by 30 September 2024.

item.title: General availability: IoT Hub Service Upgrade

item.atom:content: All IoT Hubs will be going through a service upgrade between November 2022 and April 2023 with potential impact to your IoT Hub.

item.atom:content: Create confidential VMs using Ephemeral OS disks for your stateless workloads.

item.title: Generally available: New KMS DNS in Azure US Government Cloud

item.title: API versions being retired for Azure API Management
